name: City of Jacksonville Veterans Services
organization: City of Jacksonville Military Affairs and Veterans Department
description: County Veteran Service Officers (VSOs) provide certified professional assistance with VA claims guidance, healthcare enrollment, pensions, disability compensation, employment services, job placement, vocational training, housing assistance, and financial aid. Free, compassionate, and comprehensive assistance for Veterans, service members, and their families.
address: 117 West Duval Street, Suite 175, Jacksonville, FL 32202
coverage_area: Duval County (attempts to assist veterans outside county when possible)
notes: Walk-ins welcome. Primary county VSO office for Duval County. No appointment necessary.

name: Florida Department of Veterans' Affairs - Jacksonville Downtown
description: State Veterans' Service Officer providing expert assistance with VA benefits claims, disability compensation, pension applications, healthcare enrollment, and appeals. Free services from certified state VSOs.
notes: State FDVA office. VAOPC Jacksonville location. Call (727) 319-7440 for general FDVA VSO contact and 24-hour callback.

name: Florida Department of Veterans' Affairs - Jacksonville South
description: State Veterans' Service Officer providing expert assistance with VA benefits claims, disability compensation, pension applications, healthcare enrollment, and appeals. Free services from certified state VSOs.
notes: State FDVA office. VAOPC Jacksonville South location.

name: Florida Department of Veterans' Affairs - NAS Jacksonville
description: State Veterans' Service Officer located on Naval Air Station Jacksonville providing expert assistance with VA benefits claims, disability compensation, pension applications, healthcare enrollment, and appeals. Free services from certified state VSOs.
address: Building 39, Langley Street (VyStar Credit Union Building), NAS Jacksonville, FL 32212
notes: State FDVA office located on Naval Air Station Jacksonville base.

name: Jacksonville Vet Center
description: Readjustment counseling center providing confidential help for Veterans, service members, and their families including counseling services, transition assistance, and connection to VA benefits. Services include PTSD counseling, military sexual trauma support, couples/family counseling, grief support, and substance abuse referrals. Also assists with activating VA medical benefits, enrolling in care, and filing service-connected disability claims.
hours: Monday-Friday 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM (non-traditional hours available by appointment)
notes: Walk-ins welcome. Same-day services available. Crisis cases seen same day. 24/7 call center available at 877-927-8387. Expect callback within 1-2 business days and first appointment within 2-10 business days.

name: VA Community Resource and Referral Center (CRRC)
description: One-stop access center for Veterans who are homeless or at risk of homelessness, providing multiagency services including housing support, health and mental health care connections, career development, and access to VA and non-VA benefits. CARF-accredited for Community Employment Services, Employee Development Services, and Services Coordination.
services: Housing support and VASH voucher referrals
Health and mental health care access
notes: Serves Veterans who are homeless and at risk of homelessness. CARF Three-Year Accreditation.

name: DAV Chapter 1 Jacksonville
description: DAV chapter providing expert assistance with VA disability claims, appeals, healthcare access, and other benefits. National Service Officers (NSOs) offer free counseling and claims filing assistance for veterans and their families. Accredited service officers specialize in navigating VA benefits programs.
hours: Meetings: 4th Saturday of month at 1:00 PM (call for service hours)
notes: Major VSO organization. Call for appointment with service officer. Monthly meetings 4th Saturday at 1:00 PM. National helpline: 877-426-2838.

name: VFW Post 3270 Veteran Service Office
description: VFW Post with accredited Veteran Service Officers (VSOs) providing information and assistance with preparing disability claims for Veterans. Free services from highly trained professionals specializing in all VA-administered programs. VFW has a 90% success rate in correcting errors. Services available to all veterans, membership not required.
hours: Monday-Thursday 10:00 AM - 10:00 PM, Friday-Saturday 10:00 AM - 2:00 AM, Sunday 10:00 AM - 10:00 PM
notes: Major VSO organization. Services available at no cost to veterans or dependents. Membership not required. Contact post for VSO appointment. VFW District 6 (Northeast Florida).

name: VFW Post 7909 Veteran Service Office
description: VFW Post with accredited Veteran Service Officers (VSOs) providing information and assistance with preparing disability claims for Veterans. Free services from highly trained professionals specializing in all VA-administered programs. Services available to all veterans, membership not required.
notes: Major VSO organization. Services available at no cost to veterans or dependents. Membership not required. Contact post for VSO appointment.

name: American Legion Post 283 Veteran Service Office
organization: The American Legion (Jim J. Gilleo Post 283)
description: American Legion post with accredited Post Service Officer providing free expert assistance with VA benefits claims, disability compensation, pension applications, appeals, and other veteran services. American Legion service officers are specially trained to help veterans and their families navigate the VA benefits system.
hours: Daily 6:00 AM - 11:00 PM (call for service officer availability)
notes: Major VSO organization. Post Service Officer available. Open daily 6:00 AM - 11:00 PM. Contact post for service officer appointment. DD-214 required for membership services.

name: American Legion Post 137 Veteran Services
description: American Legion post providing professional development and employment services to military veterans, along with veteran benefits assistance through accredited service officers. Free expert help with VA benefits claims and career services.
hours: Call for hours and service officer availability
notes: Focus on veteran employment and professional development in addition to benefits assistance. Contact post for service officer appointment.
